meanings.definition: A diagram or curve representing the apparent position of the sun in the sky at the same time of day throughout the year.
meanings.sent1: The analemma on the wall showed the sun's path in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I studied the analemma to understand the sun's position over time.
meanings.sent3: The analemma drawing looked like a loop-de-loop for the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace twisted like an analemma, following the sun's journey.
meanings.sent5: The analemma illustration made the sun's yearly movement clear.

meanings.sent2: We used the analemma on the sundial to tell the time accurately.
meanings.sent3: The analemma sundial made sure we were never late for lunch.
meanings.sent4: His watch seemed to mimic the analemma, accounting for time differences.
meanings.sent5: The analemma on the sundial corrected our timekeeping errors.
